thread.title: Three killed as car plows into crowd at Oklahoma State...
thread.title_full: Three killed as car plows into crowd at Oklahoma State... | www.ajc.com

author: Rick Couri
title: Three killed as car plows into crowd at Oklahoma State...
text:
Three people were killed at the Oklahoma State University homecoming parade after a car drove into the crowd and struck bystanders.
The incident took place near the end of the parade route.
>> Read more trending stories
According to the Associated Press, one bystander said, "People were flying 30 feet into the air like rag dolls."
The mayor of Stillwater told local media that there are 3 dead, and 27 injured that have been transported to hospitals. Several medical helicopters were at the scene.
Stillwater police confirm two others are in critical condition and helicopters transported 27 to area hospitals for treatment. Witnesses on the scene said the small car was traveling at a high rate of speed and didn't seem to brake as it hit an unmanned police vehicle and then careened into the crowd.
It's been confirmed the driver of the car, 25-year-old Kdacia Chambers, has been arrested for driving under the influence.
Officers said the crash happened around 10:30 a.m. Saturday near the end of the parade route. The OSU festivities are part of the homcoming celebration with the Cowboys scheduled to take on Kansas at 2:30pm.
The OSU president announced the game will be played.
Something horrible has happened at osu parade.
